sub_topic: Calculating the pH of inorganic acid-base reactions
message_1: What is the pH of a 0.1 M solution of hydrochloric acid (HCl)?
message_2:
To calculate the pH of a 0.1 M solution of hydrochloric acid (HCl), we need to use the formula:

pH = -log10[H+]

Hydrochloric acid is a strong acid, which means it completely dissociates in water. So, the concentration of hydrogen ions [H+] in the solution will be equal to the concentration of the HCl solution.

[H+] = 0.1 M

Now, we can plug this value into the pH formula:

pH = -log10(0.1)

pH = -(-1)

pH = 1

So, the pH of a 0.1 M solution of hydrochloric acid (HCl) is 1.
